event.name: New Year's Eve Party
foodTips: Elegant appetizers are expected - this is a dressy event.
Late-night food is essential - sliders or pizza around 12:30am.
Heavy apps early, lighter as midnight approaches.
Sweet treats for after midnight - champagne and dessert pair perfectly.
Breakfast items for really late parties - mini quiches, bacon strips.
event.foodBuyingGuide: NYE is about elegant appetizers and champagne. Plan 8-10 appetizer pieces per person for the main event, plus late-night snacks for after midnight. End with something sweet.
proTips: 70% of champagne is consumed between 11:30pm and 12:15am - time your chilling.
Have champagne COLD and ready to pour at 11:55pm.
People pace themselves until 10pm then drinking accelerates.
Late-night parties need designated drivers or Uber - plan ahead.
Noisemakers and party favors should be near the champagne station.
event.buyingGuide: This is THE champagne event. Plan 1 bottle per 3-4 guests for the midnight toast, plus additional for cocktails (French 75s, Kir Royale). Have regular bar options for earlier in the evening. Stock more than you think - better to have leftovers than run out at midnight.

meta.title: How Much Pizza for 20 Guests New Year's Eve Party? | 7 pizzas
meta.description: Need pizza for a 20-person new year's eve party? You'll need exactly 7 pizzas. Free calculator with pro tips for party planning.
meta.h1: How Much Pizza for a 20 Guests New Year's Eve Party?

mathExplanation.label: Estimate actual eaters
mathExplanation.explanation: At small events, about 95% of guests will eat full servings.

mathExplanation.label: Calculate servings (as main dish)
mathExplanation.explanation: As a main dish, plan for 3 pizzas per person.

mathExplanation.label: Apply new year's eve party modifier
mathExplanation.explanation: New Year's Eve Partys typically consume 20% less pizza than average.

mathExplanation.label: Add 15% buffer & round up
mathExplanation.explanation: Always round up and add a buffer. Running out of food is worse than having leftovers!
